author: Alex Richards
title: Chelsea confident Antonio Conte will remain in charge next season despite Inter Milan 'agreement'
text:
Sport Chelsea confident Antonio Conte will remain in charge next season despite Inter Milan 'agreement' The Italian, who has led the Blues 10 points clear at the top of the Premier League, has been linked with a big money return to Serie A Share Conte has enjoyed an excellent debut season (Photo: Chelsea FC via Getty Images) Share Get Chelsea FC     
Chelsea are not worried over suggestions Antonio Conte will ditch the club in the summer. 
According to reports in England claiming to cite Tuttosport, the Blues boss has 'agreed' a return to his homeland to become manager of Inter Milan. 
It’s widely claimed that Conte is suffering from homesickness and has been offered a huge deal to return to Italy. 
Conte, 47, has taken the Premier League by storm in his debut season, leading the Blues to a 10 point lead atop the table. A smiling Conte with Cesc Fabregas on Saturday (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) Read More John Terry refuses to rule out Chinese Super League switch 
However, Tuttosport claims that he wants a return to Serie A - which he won on three consecutive occasions as manager of Juventus - and has been offered a four-year deal worth €15million per season. 
The newspaper similarly reported last month that Conte was wanted and would be offered a €400million war chest to join the Nerazzurri. 
And there are also reports from La Repubblica that Conte has a 'strained' relationship with Roman Abramovich. 
However, suggestions a deal has been agreed, or that Conte has begun initiating proceedings to secure his Blues exit, are unfounded. 
Chelsea officials fully believe that the Italian will lead the club into the Champions League next season. 
Conte has spoken of remaining at the club for years to come and is understood to be happy with the work he is doing in west London, and the challenge of vying to be No.1 against the likes of Jose Mourinho, Pep Guardiola and Jurgen Klopp. Conte with his family, celebrating a title triumph at Juventus (Photo: Getty) Conte is very much on for a Premier League and FA Cup double (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Conte moved to England last summer, after quitting the Italy job to return to club management. 
But the ex-Azzurri chief arrived in the UK on his own, leaving his wife and daughter in Italy. The pair were in attendance for the weekend win over Swansea and are looking to join him in London, when her school year ends. 
His contract at Stamford Bridge has two years to run, and Inter would have to pay a big compensation package to land Conte. 
Yet under the ownership of the Suning Group - who also bankroll Chinese Super League side Jiangsu Suning - money is available as the Inter hierarchy look to challenge for the Scudetto, having struggled to keep pace with rivals Juve in recent years. Current Inter chief Stefano Pioli (Photo: AFP) Read More Victor Moses knows there can be no mercy at Monday's West Ham reunion 
Stefano Pioli replaced Frank de Boer as Inter boss after a disappointing start to the season, and has led the club into European contention after 10 wins in their last 13 league games. 
But despite his fine work, questions continue to be asked over whether the ex-Lazio chief is a sexy enough name for the club’s hierarchy. 
He would be in line for minimal compensation should Inter decide on a different direction this summer, having only inked an 18-month deal when replacing his predecessor. Video Loading
